review: Perhaps later this year i will up the rating but so few apps support this device as to make it of pretty limited use.  For example it does not support Picasa.  That would be a major use for me and a great convenience.  If you have an older TV that does not have Hulu or Netflix built in I would raise the rating to 4 or 5 stars.It was extremely easy to install.  it does what it does well.  unfortunately it isn't much.
author: Seymour Friedel "Thing Doctor"

review: I purchased this primarily to test and see what you got for $35. The setup was incredibly easy to use and took around 5 minutes.My favorite feature is the sharing of specific tabs in Google Chrome with the chromecast.I have had streaming issues and there currently is not a lot if development for it. There is a tom of potential for Chrimecast, but it falls short in comparison to an Apple TV or Roku. That being said, the price is right and there is definitely $35 in value with it.
author: Harness TechED

review: Great product design and effortless installation. Wished the attached HDMI cable was longer.I could have given it 5 if it supports cast for files stored on my system as well as on my phone.
author: Maleficent

review: The Google Chromecast HDMI Streaming Media Player does exactly what it claims to do and does it very well.  We are now able to connect our laptop computer (wirelessly) to our widescreen TV.  Once installed...the device is easy to use and picture quality is wonderful!  My only complaint has to do with initial setup.  My wife who has way better-than-average computer skills had to have a professional come over and complete the initial setup.  Router connection was more problematic than anticipated.  Chromecast works great but is definitely NOT a simple connect-and-go device.
author: R. Kennedy "rooster"

review: I got this item bundled with a Netflix subscription for my sister as a gift for Christmas. She had no idea what it was. By the end of the day she said that it "was hands down the best gift ever". She started binge watching Game of Thrones and Breaking Bad immediately.
author: Michael Wolfe

review: I am an early adopter of Google devices. And so far not disappointed by their delivery.Here all you spend for the device is $35. The value you get is enormous. Netflix, Hulu and YouTube usually cover most streaming demands. However, there are more apps coming now.Ability to stream Amazon videos would be nice for me being prime member. But that absence is not Google's fault.
author: Debasis Goswami

review: The item works great. The chormecast was worth every penny I spend. Google chormecast is the best way the stream Online videos on your TV.
author: Lesley

review: Check it out closely! It gets power via normal USB (NOT THE SERVICE USB). I hardly ever use it. Slim offerings. More Google invasion.
author: Gerald Wheeler

review: Very disapointed in google chromecast.  I have a LG Optimus G phone that it is not compatible with, a proscan tv that it is not compatible with, and an xfinity router that it doesn't like as well. I called Google and their staff was very helpful but I have had it for over a month and have never gotten it to work yet. I have given up on it. Nice idea, too bad for me that it doesn't work.
author: Thomas S Galyean

review: Absolutely a great product! Worked right out of the box. iPhone apps - netflix works perfectly so does youtube - hbo go latent connection but will eventually work (this is more due to app than product). Chromecast via laptop (google browser) works perfectly and this all works with my DSL internet connection - amazing!
